name: Kilobaser
headline: Desktop DNA Printer. The Nespresso Machine for DNA.
description: We combined microfluidic chip technology and a reagent cartridge to create the first personal DNA synthesizer. Until now most life scientists had to rely on out-sourced DNA synthesis, causing stagnating research. Kilobaser empowers every life scientist to synthesize DNA on their benchtop.

founders.name: Bernhard Tittelbach, Founder
founders.description:
Likes to have an ever more accurate model of the world. Interested in how things work. Likes to take apart, hack and create things, to understand them better. Interested in various frameworks that allow people to work together.
Sometimes Speaker at talks, helper at events and holder of workshops.
Life Goal: Create net gain for everyone, leave the world a slightly better place and come out ahead as well.
Would love for everyone to learn rationality and probability theory in school.

generated_description:
**Kilobaser Overview**

**Founded:** 2014  
**Location:** Graz, Austria  
**Team Size:** 10 Employees  
**Y Combinator Batch:** W21  
**Website:** [Kilobaser](https://www.kilobaser.com)

---

**Mission & Vision**  
Kilobaser is on a clear mission to democratize access to DNA synthesis with its innovative product: the **Kilobaser One-XT**, the first microfluidic chip and cartridge-based personal DNA and RNA synthesizer. This device aims to revolutionize laboratory practices by allowing life scientists to synthesize custom DNA right at their benchtops—no more waiting for outsourced services. Think of it as the **Nespresso Machine for DNA**. 

**The Problem**  
Traditionally, researchers faced long delays and inflated costs when outsourcing DNA synthesis. This bottleneck has stifled innovation in life sciences. Kilobaser aims to empower researchers by putting the power of DNA synthesis in their hands, significantly speeding up the research process.

**Product Offerings**  
Kilobaser’s main product is the **Kilobaser One-XT**, which enables users to create custom DNA and RNA on-demand quickly, efficiently, and independently. They also offer a variety of cartridges for different applications, including **sample oligos** and **multi-rack systems** for larger production needs.

**Use Cases & Impact**  
Users are finding various applications for the Kilobaser synthesizers. From supporting PCR testing for SARS-CoV-2 to assisting in molecular cloning, this technology unlocks possibilities that were previously confined to larger labs with more resources.

**Customer Experiences**  
Testimonials from researchers indicate that Kilobaser is a game-changer. Users appreciate the ease of operation and the quick delivery of results. For instance, Tam Yew Joon, CSO of Biogenes Technologies, calls it a "game-changer" in the world of oligo synthesis.

**Technical Edge**  
Kilobaser's technology combines microfluidic precision with the simplicity of a cartridge system. This unique approach not only lowers the barrier to entry for DNA synthesis in research but also promises higher efficiency in producing oligonucleotides.

**Market Positioning**  
Kilobaser operates in the niche of hard-tech hardware and medical devices, focusing on life sciences. This positioning allows them to tap into a market that is rapidly embracing in-house solutions for DNA and RNA synthesis.

**Engagement Opportunities**  
For those interested in exploring Kilobaser's offerings, the company provides opportunities for live demonstrations to truly understand the simplicity and impact of their technology. You can also order sample oligos and book online demos through their website.

---

In a nutshell, Kilobaser is not just selling a product; they are enabling a new paradigm in DNA synthesis that empowers researchers to experiment, innovate, and accelerate breakthroughs—right from their own labs. If you're involved in life sciences and want to upgrade your capabilities, you’ll definitely want to keep an eye on Kilobaser.
